title: looking for "Inkpen2script"
content:
Hello,

I am looking for a free font I used last year, “Inkpen2script”. I lost my fonts in a hard disk crash and I can’t find it anywhere.

If it’s not been pulled for some type of copyright or propriety issue, I would love to have it back. My email is [typophile@lob.ws](mailto:typophile@lob.ws).

It’s the font used for “The Women of Rodgers & Hammerstein” in this graphic:

[http://lob.ws/nlad-public/NLAD.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080824070946/http:/lob.ws/nlad-public/NLAD.html "http://lob.ws/nlad-public/NLAD.html")

thanks

-Stuart

 [‹ 't hey' ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080824070946/http:/typophile.com/node/47820 "Go to previous forum topic") [Is the quality of architecture slowly declining? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080824070946/http:/typophile.com/node/47626 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wistlo

comments.content:
No clue how/how much its distribution is limited, or I’d just upload the file and link you to it.

Peace,  
JT

Here it is.

[http://bbbw831.tripod.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080824070946/http:/bbbw831.tripod.com/ "http://bbbw831.tripod.com/")

When you download it, the extension will be .htm

Change the extension to .ttf
